title: Congruence
content: A congruence class: residue a modulo n with n > 0. The building block of covering systems.

title: Satisfies Congruence
content: An integer x satisfies congruence (a, n) if x ≡ a (mod n).

title: Congruence System
content: A finite set of congruences with distinct moduli. This is the central structure.

title: Covered Integer
content: An integer is covered if it satisfies at least one congruence in the system.

title: Uncovered Integer
content: An integer is uncovered if it satisfies NO congruence. The density of such integers is the key measure.

title: Uncovered Density
content: The fraction of integers up to M that are uncovered. This converges to the asymptotic density.

title: Asymptotic Uncovered Density
content: The liminf of uncovered density as M → ∞. This is what we want to make ≤ ε.

title: ε-Almost Covering
content: A system where asymptotic uncovered density is at most ε. The goal is to achieve small ε.

title: Perfect Covering
content: Every integer is covered (ε = 0). A much stronger condition than almost-covering.

title: Moduli in Range
content: All moduli lie in [N, M]. The question is about bounded ranges [N, CN].

title: Natural Density
content: The product ∏(1 - 1/n) over moduli in [m₁, m₂]. This is the best achievable density by averaging.

title: Erdős Conjecture
content: There exists C > 1 such that for all ε > 0 and N ≥ 1, an ε-almost covering exists with moduli in [N, CN].

title: Conjecture Negation
content: For all C > 1, some ε and N fail. This is what was PROVED - the conjecture is FALSE.

title: Critical Exponent
content: α(N) = log log log N / (4 log log N). For C ≤ N^{α(N)}, almost-covering fails.

title: FFKPY Main Theorem
content: For C ≤ N^{α(N)}, uncovered density ≥ (1/2) · ∏(1 - 1/n_i). The core of the disproof.

title: Conjecture Disproved
content: The Erdős conjecture is FALSE. No constant C works for all ε and N.

title: Growing C Works
content: If C is allowed to grow with N, ε-almost coverings DO exist for any fixed ε.

title: Sufficient C
content: C = N^{1/log log N} suffices for any fixed ε. Shows what DOES work.
